title: Interpreting a signaling pathway Set member 1

content.question: Based on the information provided, which of the following best justifies the claim that osteocalcin is a hormone?

choices.label: The phosphorylation of the insulin receptor causes a response in osteoblast bone cells.
The osteoblasts in the bone secrete osteocalcin, which causes cells in the pancreas to change their activity.

The change in expression of <math alttext="E s p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> changes the insulin receptor activity of the osteoblast.
The activation of the osteocalcin by a bone cell is <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> dependent.

content.answer: The osteoblasts in the bone secrete osteocalcin, which causes cells in the pancreas to change their activity.

skill.text: 6.C: Provide reasoning to justify a claim by connecting evidence to biological theories.
